org.apache.derbyTesting.junit

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    General non-JDBC related utilities. Some of these were relocated from TestUtil.

      The newline character(s).

    • Method Detail

      • stringToHexLiteral

        public static java.lang.String stringToHexLiteral(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a string to a hex literal to assist in converting test cases that used to insert strings into bit data tables.

        Converts using UTF-16BE just like the old casts used to.

        Parameters:
        s - string to convert
        Returns:
        hex literal that can be inserted into a bit column.

      • convertToHexString

        private static java.lang.String convertToHexString(byte[] buf)
        Convert a byte array to a hex string suitable for insert.
        Parameters:
        buf - byte array to convert
        Returns:
        formated string representing byte array

      • repeatChar

        public static java.lang.String repeatChar(java.lang.String c,
                                          int repeatCount)
        Creates a string with the specified length.

        Called from various tests to test edge cases and such.

        Parameters:
        c - character to repeat
        repeatCount - Number of times to repeat character
        Returns:
        String of repeatCount characters c

      • showResultSet

        public static void showResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Print out resultSet in two dimensional array format, for use by JDBC.assertFullResultSet(rs,expectedRows) expectedRows argument. Useful while converting tests to get output in correct format.
        Parameters:
        rs - result set to print
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if accessing the result set fails

      • getSysinfoLocally

        public static java.io.BufferedReader getSysinfoLocally()
        Calls the public method getInfo of the sysinfo tool within this JVM and returns a BufferedReader for reading its output. This is useful for obtaining system information that could be used to verify, for example, values returned by Derby MBeans.
        Returns:
        a buffering character-input stream containing the output from sysinfo
        See Also:
        sysinfo.getInfo(java.io.PrintWriter out)

      • getSysinfoFromServer

        public static java.io.BufferedReader getSysinfoFromServer()
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception

        Calls the public method getSysInfo of the Network Server instance associated with the current test configuration and returns the result as a BufferedReader, making it easy to analyse the output line by line.

        This is useful for obtaining system information that could be used to verify, for example, values returned by Derby MBeans.

        Returns:
        a buffering character-input stream containing the output from the server's sysinfo.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        NetworkServerControl.getSysinfo()

      • split

        public static java.lang.String[] split(java.lang.String str,
                                       char delim)
        Splits a string around matches of the given delimiter character. Copied from org.apache.derby.iapi.util.StringUtil Where applicable, this method can be used as a substitute for String.split(String regex), which is not available on a JSR169/Java ME platform.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be split
        delim - the delimiter
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if str is null

      • sleep

        public static void sleep(long millis)
        Sleeps the specified number of milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        millis - sleep duration

      • formatTestClassNames

        public static java.lang.String formatTestClassNames(java.lang.String test)
        Function to eliminate known package prefixes given a class full path
        Parameters:
        test - class name prefixed with package
